text: Welcome to AnimationHub. Today we're
going to look at creating a stylized
simple outline material. So, let's get
to it. In the content browser,
rightclick and create a material. Open
the material by doubleclicking the newly
created asset and in the material
editor, right click on metallic setting
and choose promote to parameter. Set the
parameter to 1.0.
Now right click on the specular setting
and select promote to parameter. Set the
parameter to 0.0.
And finally right click on the roughness
setting and select promote to parameter.
Set the parameter to 1.0.
In the graph area, right click and type
camera vector WS and select it to create
the node. Next, right click and type
pixel normal and select the pixel normal
WS node.
Dragging from the outpin on the camera
vector node, type do fortproduct
to create the node. And then dragging
from the outpin of the pixel normal
worldspace node, connect it to the B pin
of the product. Dragging from the outpin
on the product node, create a power
node. Right click on the exp setting and
promote to parameter.
Dragging from the outpin on the power
node, create a multiply node.
Right click on the B setting and promote
to parameter. Name it outline intensity.
Dragging from the multiply nodes outpin,
type subtract and create the subtract
node. Right click on its B pin and
promote to parameter. Name it outline
influence.
Drag from the outpin on the subtract
node and connect it to both the base
color and emissive color settings on the
material block. That's it. To see the
result, save the material and close the
graph. In the content browser, right
click on the material and select create
material instance.
Drag the material instance onto a mesh
in your level.
Doubleclick the material instance to
adjust the parameters of the material to
your liking.
I hope this was helpful. See you next
time.
